name: Montaro
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7/8/8.1/10 32/64bit Processor: Intel Core 2 Duo or greater Memory: 256 MB RAM Graphics: Intel HD Graphics 4000 or greater DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 160 MB available space

reviews.review_text: It's worth a dollar
I'm going to be the first MLG player in this game.

This game is surprisingly detailed for the pricetag. I recommend this game to anyone that's looking for a challenge, but also for the funny costumes and fun times, just watch out for the birds and sewer holes.

A scandalously priced infinite runner in which you play as a shibe called もんたろう who likes to kick chickens. The health system is schoolgirls' panties which you replenish by flicking their skirts up with wind.  Eight alternate outfits to choose from, 10/10 soundtrack. God speed Montaro, you glorious ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥.
if anything simulates being a stupid ♥♥♥♥ing 9gagger, then it's this game

I love panties. I collect panties.  Now seeing a game on Steam that holds the same values at me, was so worth the $1 price tag. This game is absoultey adorable and fun. You can dress up your Doge in costumes and slip on bananas right into a sewer. It's the best. Montaro is funny and worth spending time on, of course it does take a while to collect all 802 Pantsu, but it's worth it.  Pros: Doge Costumes Slipping on bananas into sewers Slipping on a banana into a box Snipping down crows Panties  Cons: Not enough panty color variety. Can't see how many panties I collected.  BUY THE GAME!

As many people have said, the music's pretty repetitive and yes you can die by a lot.. But overall, for the price, it's simple, fun, and is a pretty decent runner for what it is.  Also, doge. 'Nuff said.

I adore this game, it's very cute but the control makes it a little difficult to play for me personally. I much prefer pressing the space bar to jump!(especially since my laptop doesn't always register when I do left click) I don't know if it's at all possible to add the space bar as a control, but I know how difficult it is to make a game at all, so either way it is very good and absolutely adorable!

Montaro is a casual indie game with super cute elements that will brighten your day and give you positive (and edgy) vibes.  You are basically a cutesy puppy. All you have to do is click click, check out all the panties and collect coins that will unlock adorable outfits.  I personally appreciate the art and I think that 99 cents should not even matter if this little game makes a rainy day happier. I strongly recommend it!  + Cute art and animations; + A bunch of adorable stuff to unlock (also as motivation to keep playing 'till you get them all!); + Steam achievements; + Nice trading cards, badges and backgrounds; + Lovely music (that kind of 8-bit game music without making you feel annoyed); + Unique idea ♡ collecting pantsu.  - Repetitive gameplay; - No pause button (?); - I wish we had some sort of super powers that could be unlocked aswell.
Doge simulator, much wow.

If he sees underwear, humanity will be destroyed!? An original anime series from the noitaminA block, Punch Line centers on Yuuta Iridatsu, a high school student, with a peculiar habit. When he sees a girl's panties, he gets so excited he faints! After a certain incident with a ghost cat, his soul gets separated from his body. Using his special powers, Yuuta watches the daily lives of the inhabitants of an apartment and sometimes plays tricks on them. Eventually, Yuuta decides to unlock the secrets to why Earth will be destroyed and tries to save it!

Dad said he only did it for the achievements, but I saw his face as he jumped up those poor japanese girls' skirts, I saw him as he twirled into those defenceless crows, and whilst his feats were somewhat acrobatic, I know...  I will always know.  #PantsusOutForDoge

This game is very difficult, even with one button. Reminds me of the old Atari days, when one button was all you had. Of course Atari had a joystick as well. This game also reminds me of the flappy bird craze, but with more going on. If you want to waste time before an important meeting, or if you're just bored, this game will accomodate. Also, what the hell is to psychologically horrifying about this game? Someone must of been drunk when they put that tag on this game.  7/10 Would recommend
This is the best game I have ever played.

This game offers a fun run and jump based experience with a visually pleasing art style and cool features which include; unlockable skins, achievments (will be added soon), and an unlockable badge if you are into that kind of stuff.   Overall I would highly recommend this game and I am excited to see what the DEV has to offer in terms of downloadable content and new features!   I give this game a 69/69
Buy this game, you won't regret it. Promise.

REMOVE CROWS

In a singular yearning for a cryptocurrency named after himself that can only be spent on fashion accessories, the Illiterate Dog from the Internet takes a trip through the dangerous fictional land of Japan.  As everyone knows, illiterate dogs hate birds. Illiterate Dog from the Internet will get in fights with chickens, blackbirds, and crows. Crows can be defeated if Illiterate Internet Dog bounces off a banana to strike it!  Be warned, though.   Bouncing off banana peels to strike crows costs you half of a pair of schoolgirl panties. Naturally. The only way to replenish your supply of 'Six halves of school girl panties' is to literally jump under their skirt and take it.  Illiterate Internet Dog is a bit of an antihero, but he gets away with it in your hearts... if only not while you play this game and kill him a thousand times.

Basically you're a doge and you run through the city collecting coins, avoiding chickens and crows(?), slipping on bananas, and stealing girls' underwear. There are also some pretty nice costumes you can unlock. This game is overall pretty satisfying. 10/10 don't try this at home.

Well there really isn't much to it, you play as a shiba inu wandering around town collecting Doge Coins while avoiding obstacles. There's honestly nothing mind blowing about it or anything, just a small and short game that'll kill maybe an hour or two (still kinda fun tho).  There is only one control which is leftclick to jump and you can cash in the Doge Coins for some costumes for your dog, with some of them having some cool references.   It's only like a dollar so you might as well get it.    oh yeah and you get to flip up girls skirts, for whatever reason.

Game is addicting, with simple controls and very cute graphics. I love all the memes. There is a lot of potential for growth here, too, and I don't know what the devs intents are - but I hope they keep expanding for more pantsu. More costumes, achievements, and game modes would be awesome.   Pros: 1.) Good music, give me an ost 2.) Enjoyable graphics 3.) Not boring. Each time I fail I try harder on the next round to get farther. 4.) Mood booster   If I had to pick ANYTHING as a 'con' to the game...it would be that this game does not have fullscreen capability. For me, it's not a dealbreaker and doesn't bother me.   Love it, keep it up :)

So after a fun session I found my new lovely, lay back game. the game works perfectly fine although I do have some things to say.  After a while the starting area becomes a bit dull, you see it so much that you kinda get annoyed by it (especially if you suck like me). I would maybe recommend making that random as well were you start. The kek memes I thought of and unlockable skins did keep me going to unlock them. But in addition to just skins why not abilities? make doge go faster or have some unlocks (panty gun?).   To make it easier for myself I bound a key of my keyboard to lmb so I just pressed a simple button instead of the button (I thought I had to click on doge).  One thing that should deffinitly change is the little cat their hitbox', it is enormous and usually unfair. pls fix  well made game, just like jackie-chan 8/10

It's a fairly simple game. Jump, collect coins, avoid obstacles, collect pantsu.  The music is really cute, the visuals are really cute, and it gets quite addicting after a while. I got all the achievements after about two hours, but I'll probably come back to this game just to kill time if I don't feel like playing anything else.

Such doge. Much sweet pantsu ;^).   For real though.  It's a nice little game on the level of a flash game. Montaro gives me flashbacks of Flappy Bird, but something about an 'a-doge-able' shiba inu getting taken out by a horde of raving chickens has a sort of charm to it.   The costumes are 10/10 and the soundtrack is pretty decent to be listening too.  The only things that are a pain is the tedious grinding for 802 pantsu (if you're an achivement hoe like me) and the fact that you can only use your mouse (left click) to make doge-chan jump. In all honesty, I just setup a autoclicker with my space bar as the trigger and went ham.   I give this game a 8/10 doges.
It's peanut butter and doge time  10/10

As a person obcessed with dogs, it is my civic duty to buy games based around dogs.  Let me tell you, Montaro is a game for the common dog. As a person obcessed with dogs, I've lived out Montaro's lifestyle. Experienced his pains, frustrations, running into crows, as well as stealing panties from various high schoolers. It is a rough life and this game shows you that. The goal is to live on the neverending street, surviving on nothing but panties while grabbing coins. Overall by the end you experience how rough it is to be Montaro himself.  10/10, free Montaro from his suffering.

If you're looking for a positive review, then you're in the wrong place, HOWEVER, if you're here for a tremendous chicken Stir Fry recipe, THEN LOOK NO FURTHER!  - Serves 4 - 10 mins to prepare and 10 mins to cook - 325 calories / serving - Healthy  INGREDIENTS:  - 1 orange, zested and juiced - 2tbsp soy sauce - 2tbsp sesame oil - 250g (8oz) tender stem broccoli - 5cm (2in) piece root ginger - 1tbsp sunflower oil - 1 garlic clove, finely sliced - 1 red pepper, deseeded and thinly sliced - 150g Straight To Wok Noodles - 400g (13oz) chicken fillet, cut into thin slices  METHOD  Step 1 - Mix together the orange zest and juice, soy sauce and sesame oil and set aside.  Step 2 - Blanch the broccoli in boiling water for 2 minutes, then drain well and set aside.  Step 3 - Finely shred the ginger. Then heat a large frying pan or wok, add the sunflower oil, heat it until sizzling, and fry the ginger till it's crisp.  Step 4 - When it's done, remove with a slotted spoon. Add the chicken and garlic, and stir-fry until just browned. Remove the meat using a slotted spoon and set aside.  Step 5 - Add the red pepper and broccoli and stir-fry for around 2-3 minutes until it's just tender. Add the soy sauce mixture, bring it to the boil then return the chicken to the pan and heat through. Serve with noodles.

Another shovelwave title to add to your Steam library. For .99 cents wouldn't be a bad price if the game wasn't so broken. It's a shame too because I think it could have been a fun game if it weren't for a few things. Now the graphics are really nice, the soundtrack is not bad and the objective of the game is simple. However there are a few things that really bog this game down. You have almost no control over your character other than jump. It is not clear on what will kill you and want won't. For example there are some cats in the background, they don't hurt you except one type. How was I suppose to know? It blends in with the background. The hit detective is off. Sometimes you can kill the crows but most of the time you can't? Why? The worst thing is they cause permanent death. Hordes of chickens also cause permanent death. You trigger them by hitting the one chicken on the fence but most of the time you will hit it because it's unavoidable like most things in the game. If you were to move your character left and right this wouldn't be a problem. I only bought this because it's a game about the doge meme and I wanted to get the achievements because of it but you can't get the achievements. Either they are broken or very cryptic to get. It doesn't explain how to get them. This game needs a lot of work. As of right now it's a 1/10.  UPDATE:  I revisited the game. The dev has put in the achievements. After a few gameplays you start to notice what kills you and what doesn't. There is still a problem with lack of controls. It'd be great if you can move doge but you can't other than jumping. A lot of objects are very unavoidable and you have to time it right. This game still feels like it's lacking. This game feels like one of those generic app games you find free on your phone. It's just a time waster for easy achievements and cards. 4/10 is my new score.

This game has doge, really good graphics, varying environments and great ideas. But it doesn't have anything fun.  The randomly generated levels just don't work. Sometimes you can't do anything to doge obstacles, you can decide between falling into a sewer and jumping into a crow. Or you can decide between walking into a banana which catapults you into a flock of chicken or jumping over the banana and landing in the flock yourself. Every obstacle except for the bananas which can be used as catapults instantly kill you even though you have 3 lives. Sometimes you're lucky and survive for 2 minutes, sometimes you already die at the first obstacle after 10 seconds.  The game also has lots of tearing.  The only thing worth playing for is collecting coins which are scattered on the roofs you sometimes can't even reach. But what for? So you can enjoy not having fun with new costumes.  Seriously, this game could be really good, but it needs a LOT more polishing. Sure, it costs less than a dollar, but in the era of indie games you can get way more for that amount of money. Don't get fooled by the positive reviews, the game only gets thumbed up because of the doge meme. The gameplay isn't worth the mention.
